title: Ian Wright hits out at Pep Guardiola's critics as he insists it's 'rubbish' to suggest he has lost the plot
text:
Ian Wright hits out at Pep Guardiola's critics as he insists it's 'rubbish' to suggest he has lost the plot The Manchester City boss has been the subject of criticism during his first season in England Share Wright has called out Guardiola's critics (Photo: REUTERS) Share Get football   Thank you for subscribing!   
Former Arsenal and England striker Ian Wright has sprung to the defence of Manchester City boss Pep Guardiola, insisting that the criticism thrown his way is 'rubbish'. 
The former Bayern Munich and Barcelona boss has suffered an inconsistent first season in the Premier League, with his side sitting in third place, 12 points behind leaders Chelsea and were knocked out of the Champions League by Monaco last week. 
Guardiola arrived at the Etihad having won a succession of trophies in Spain and Germany but has been criticised in some quarters for taking his time to adapt to challenge of English football. 
And former Gunners frontman Wright believes this criticism is unwarranted. Guardiola has been accused of losing the plot (Photo: Getty) Read More Guardiola looked a novice as defending more Sunday League than Champions League doomed City 
"It is absolute rubbish that Pep has been found out at Manchester City and that the Premier League is too difficult for him," he writes in the Sun . 
"It was always going to take time. Maybe it will take longer than Pep thought initially but he is going about it the right way. People are jumping on every sign — he’s too tetchy, he’s getting the hump about everything... 
"They are just waiting to almost tease him at any opportunity." Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
